name: Shenandoah Suburban Bus Lines, Inc., Case
name_abbreviation: Shenandoah Suburban Bus Lines, Inc., Case

judges: Before Maxey, C. J., Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson, Stearns and Jones, JJ.
parties: Shenandoah Suburban Bus Lines, Inc., Case.

opinions.text:
Opinion Per Curiam,
Appeals dismissed and Order of the Commission reversed on the opinion of the Superior Court, reported in 158 Pa. Superior Ct. 688, 46 A.2d 26.
opinions.author: Opinion Per Curiam,

attorneys: H. Ray Pope, Jr., with Mm Vincent P. McDevitt and James H. Duff, Attorney General, for Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission, appellant.
Frank A. Sinon, with him Paul H. Rhoads and Weiss, Rhoads & Sinon, for Schuylkill Transit Company, intervening appellant.
James H. Booser, with him McNees, Wallace & Nu-tick and Sterling G. McNees, for Harry Gibson et al., intervening appellants.
John M. Smith, Jr., with him James J. Gallagher, for Shenandoah Suburban Bus Lines, Inc., appellee.
Barrett G. Tawresey, with him Daniel J. Ferguson, for Shenandoah Borough Council et al., intervening appellees.
casebody.head_matter:
Shenandoah Suburban Bus Lines, Inc., Case.
Argued December 3, 1946.
Before Maxey, C. J., Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson, Stearns and Jones, JJ.
H. Ray Pope, Jr., with Mm Vincent P. McDevitt and James H. Duff, Attorney General, for Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission, appellant.
Frank A. Sinon, with him Paul H. Rhoads and Weiss, Rhoads & Sinon, for Schuylkill Transit Company, intervening appellant.
James H. Booser, with him McNees, Wallace & Nu-tick and Sterling G. McNees, for Harry Gibson et al., intervening appellants.
John M. Smith, Jr., with him James J. Gallagher, for Shenandoah Suburban Bus Lines, Inc., appellee.
Barrett G. Tawresey, with him Daniel J. Ferguson, for Shenandoah Borough Council et al., intervening appellees.
January 6, 1947 :
